will provide Elavonâ€™s Enterprise team with a business onboarding automation platform designed to reduce manual effort, streamline data entry, and improve accuracy, compliance, and customer experience. The solution digitises key onboarding steps, minimises duplication, and enhances operational efficiency.
This engagement covers delivery of a production-ready onboarding automation platform for Elavonâ€™s Enterprise team, beginning with Marriott franchises as the initial rollout.

The project will be delivered in phases:
Phase 1 â€“ Marriott Initial Production Deploymen

Implementation of the onboarding solution for Marriott franchises in a live production environment. This phase will run for three to six months, after which Elavon will determine timing for expansion.
Rollout across Elavonâ€™s wider hospitality sector clients, with refinements based on Marriott deployment learnings.
Extension of the solution to Elavonâ€™s broader enterprise client base.

: The parties agree that if the usage of the services provided under this Agreement exceeds one thousand (1,000) applications per month, new commercial negotiations will be initiated.

: Upon reaching this threshold, the parties will engage in good faith negotiations to agree on revised commercial terms that reflect the increased usage. These negotiations will commence within thirty (30) days of the Supplier notifying the Client that the threshold has been exceeded.
Overage charges and optional services are detailed in Appendix C.

: The Supplier agrees to monitor the usage of the services provided under this Agreement. If the usage reaches seventy-five percent (75%) of the allowed limit, the Supplier shall promptly inform the Client in writing.

: The Supplier agrees not to exceed the invoiced amount without obtaining prior written approval from the Client. Any additional charges or overages must be pre-approved in writing by the Client before invoicing.
This shall take priority over the process in the MSA.

w:r.w:delText: : Elavon is allowed to utilize its own contract conditions for any add-on services provided under this Agreement. These conditions will govern the terms and execution of the add-on services, ensuring alignment with Elavon's internal policies and requirements.

: The parties agree to define "reasonable ongoing support" that does not reduce the Phase 1/2/3 build effort. This support will be provided for up to twelve (12) days per year. The retainer can be utilized for minor enhancements but not for defects already covered under the support SLA.
Appendix D â€“ Success Criteria & Performance Measurement (Phase 1)

This appendix defines the measurable success criteria for Phase 1 â€“ Marriott Initial Production Deployment. Achievement of these criteria will determine progression to Phase 2 and trigger Elavonâ€™s option to extend the contract term from one (1) year to three (3) years, as set out in Section 12.5 of this SOW.

: The parties agree to conduct a comprehensive business review of the services provided under this Agreement after a period of nine (9) months from the Effective Date. This review will assess the performance, compliance, and overall satisfaction with the services rendered.

: Following the business review, either party may terminate this Agreement by providing thirty (30) days' written notice to the other party if the review identifies significant issues that cannot be resolved to the mutual satisfaction of both parties. In the event of termination under this clause, the Service Provider shall be entitled to payment for all services rendered up to the date of termination.
Phase 1 will operate in a live production environment, processing approximately 10 Marriott applications per month. KPIs will be
measured monthly throughout the Phase 1 deployment window (3â€“6 months). Two consecutive months of KPI achievement are required to trigger contract extension.
During Phase 1 the following criteria must be achieved:

At least 10 Marriott applications per month successfully processed end-to-end using the platform, with data captured, validated, and generated into Elavonâ€™s required application pack format without duplication.
A minimum of 60 percent of applications completed without manual rework.
No more than 5 percent of applications returned due to system or formatting errors.
System availability of 99.5 percent or higher during the measurement window, excluding scheduled maintenance.
nd Severity 2 (high) incidents resolved within the agreed SLA windows.
will provide a monthly performance report detailing KPI results, exceptions, and explanatory notes. Elavon will have access to dashboards and supporting data to verify reported metrics.
KPIs may be adjusted by mutual agreement if impacted by factors outside
control, including third-party provider outages, upstream system failures, or materially incomplete or inaccurate applicant data.

Any KPI shortfall will trigger a joint remediation plan, agreed within 10 business days, specifying actions, owners, and target dates. KPIs are considered met once remediation actions are completed and verified in subsequent monthly reporting.
